Description: Tall polished red cylindrical jar with flat base made of Nile silt clay with some white inclusions, and coated on the exterior with red slip (much worn) and burnished vertically. Upper quarter of the interior also slipped and burnished.
Curator's comments: Miscellaneous class MS5 in Brunton and Caton Thomspon 1928.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (5, 23; pl. MS.5)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
